responses.rationale: The segment reports a factual outcome (mildness) rather than describing capabilities or preparedness.
The segment states a low risk level, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment states a low risk level, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes where the virus occurs, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes an expected future condition (exposure rising), not capabilities or preparedness.
Describes actions taken ('captured five other birds and sent them') which are response measures/safeguards, without active reassurance.
The segment reports an event and a finding, not capabilities or preparedness.
Describes an ongoing action ('authorities are trying to determine') which is a response measure/safeguard, without active reassurance.
The segment reports a fact about case distribution, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment reports a fact about case numbers, not capabilities or preparedness.
Describes a planned action ('whole (population of the) hall will have to be culled') which is a response measure/safeguard, without active reassurance.
The segment reports an event and context, not capabilities or preparedness.
Describes a planned action ('authorities are preparing to destroy') which is a response measure/safeguard, without active reassurance.
The segment describes how the virus is carried, not capabilities or preparedness.
Describes a recommendation/guidance ('asking people... to watch out... and call') which is a preparedness measure, without active reassurance.
Describes actions taken ('States... have temporarily banned') which are response measures/safeguards, without active reassurance.
Describes a policy/program ('Agriculture Department pays farmers') which is a safeguard/support measure, without active reassurance.
The segment reports statistics on affected birds/flocks, not capabilities or preparedness.
Describes a necessary condition/protocol ('It has to be absolutely sterile') which is a safeguard statement, without active reassurance.
The segment describes a company's status, not capabilities or preparedness.

The segment describes an economic impact, not capabilities or preparedness.

Describes an action ('watching the outbreak closely') which is a preparedness/surveillance measure, without active reassurance.
States a rule/protocol ('the whole flock has to go') which is a response measure/safeguard, without active reassurance.
Describes an effect of precautions ('Disease precautions kept Fox Business from visiting') implying safeguards are in place, without active reassurance.
The segment reports outcomes for infected animals, not capabilities or preparedness.
Describes an action taken ('tried to save') which is a response measure/safeguard, without active reassurance.
